clause.title: Letter with formal agreement-style numbering and titles

subclause1.para: This is the formal agreement-style numbering and titles. It is typically used for agreements in letter form, such as a confidentiality letter agreement. You would also use it to create a series of numbered paragraphs, each with headings.

subclause2.para: sub-paragraphs or sub-clauses would be (a), (b), and so on; and

you can choose to cross-refer to paragraphs or clauses by selecting the "clause" or "paragraph" option for the xrefname attribute of the <operative> tag. The default for a letter template is paragraph.

clause.para: This is the letter form with numbered paragraphs but no headings.

listitem.para: You can use bullets or a numbered list with these, but thereafter you need to be consistent.
Do not mix bullets and numbered lists, as these will cause the Word numbering to corrupt.

clause.para: This is the letter form with no numbering at all. Set numbering attribute on each clause to none to use this.
Please acknowledge receipt and acceptance of this letter by signing, dating and returning the enclosed copy.
